data.title: Salak Tinggi ERL Station in Salak Tinggi town
data.meta_description: Salak Tinggi ERL station is the ERL station for KLIA Transit at Salak Tinggi servicing residents at the Bandar Salak Tinggi & nearby areas
data.text:
Salak Tinggi ERL station is one of the stations for the KLIA Transit ERL train services.

It is located in the town of Salak Tinggi in Sepang, Selangor.

It started its operations in 2002 with 2 island platforms and 4 tracks. The following is the layout plan for the ERL station.

The Salak Tinggi ERL station accommodates multi-storey park-and-ride facilities at the station to cater daily commuters at the Bandar Salak Tinggi and its neighbourhood.

KLIA Transit perform routine services at this ERL station to Kuala Lumpur International Airport Terminal 1 (KLIA) and Terminal 2 (klia2), and to the Kuala Lumpur City Centre.

The KLIA Transit ride from this ERL station is 7 minutes to the KLIA terminal and 11 minutes to the klia2 terminal.

Stations for KLIA Transit KT1 KE1 KL Sentral KJ15 KL Sentral MR1 KL Sentral KA01 KS01 KL Sentral KG15 Muzium Negara KT2 Bandar Tasik Selatan SP15 Bandar Tasik Selatan KB04 Bandar Tasik Selatan KT3 Putrajaya & Cyberjaya PY41 Putrajaya Sentral KT4 Salak Tinggi KT5 KE2 KLIA KT6 KE3 klia2

★ On the klia2 to KL Sentral route, the first KLIA Transit train from this ERL station starts at 5:29am and the last train will depart at 00:41am. Review klia2 to KL Sentral train schedule.

★ On the KL Sentral to klia2 route, the first KLIA Transit train from this ERL station starts at 5:00am and the last train will depart at 00:32am. Review KL Sentral to klia2 train schedule.

The Park & ride facility that integrates the public transport system with private car use is available at the station.

This new 5-level Park & Ride covered car park was opened in May 2016 for the convenience of general public.

Location of Salak Tinggi ERL station

The Salak Tinggi ERL station is located at the town of Salak Tinggi in Sepang, Selangor.

The Xiamen University Malaysia is about 5 minutes drive away from this Salak Tinggi ERL station.

The ticketing counter and the ticket vending machines are available at the concourse.

After buying the ticket, the commuters can enter the station through the access gates and walk to the boarding platforms.

Shuttle bus services are available at the road side near the ERL station.

These shuttle buses service the Salak Tinggi town and its neighbouring areas.

Trave Time & Fare

The Salak Tinggi ERL station is the KLIA Transit station in between the Putrajaya & Cyberjaya station and the KLIA station.

This ERL station accommodates twice-hourly KLIA Transit service to KLIA, klia2 and KL Sentral, the central transportation hub in Kuala Lumpur city.

On the klia2 to KL Sentral route, the first KLIA Transit train from Salak Tinggi ERL station starts at 5:29am and the last train will depart at 00:41am. Review klia2 to KL Sentral train schedule.

On the KL Sentral to klia2 route, the first KLIA Transit train from Salak Tinggi ERL station starts at 5:00am and the last train will depart at 00:32am. Review KL Sentral to klia2 train schedule.

The KLIA Transit train performs a stop to pick up and drop off passengers at the following ERL stations.

Stations for KLIA Transit KT6 KE3 klia2 KT5 KE2 KLIA KT4 Salak Tinggi KT3 Putrajaya & Cyberjaya PY41 Putrajaya Sentral KT2 Bandar Tasik Selatan SP15 Bandar Tasik Selatan KB04 Bandar Tasik Selatan KT1 KE1 KL Sentral KJ15 KL Sentral MR1 KL Sentral KA01 KS01 KL Sentral KG15 Muzium Negara

Using the KLIA Transit train, the following are the time and train fare from Salak Tinggi ERL station to other ERL stations.

KLIA Transit Fare & Duration From Salak Tinggi ERL Station → klia2 11 mins

RM4.90 (Adult) / RM2.20 (Child) → KLIA 7 mins

RM4.90 (Adult) / RM2.20 (Child) → Putrajaya & Cyberjaya 9 mins

RM4.70 (Adult) / RM2.10 (Child) → Bandar Tasik Selatan 21 mins

RM12.40 (Adult) / RM5.60 (Child) → KL Sentral 28 mins

RM18.30 (Adult) / RM8.20 (Child)

Using the KLIA Transit? Try this Free Navigation Tool to check train routes and discover Klang Valley Integrated Transit System.

The ticketing counter is available at the main concourse of the Salak Tinggi ERL station.

Pedestrian bridge and lift is available to allow the passengers to move between platform conveniently.

Park N Ride Facility

A new 5-level Park & Ride covered car park is opened for operations in May 2016 for the convenience of general public.

The covered car park features a total of 812 car parking bays and 104 motorcycle parking bays.

The ticket machines for payment are available at level 2 and level G.

The toilets and surau are available at level G.

Parking ticket is to be collected upon entrance to the car park. And there are reserved parking spots for handicapped drivers.

The parking charge is RM3.00 per entry and the overnight charge is RM5.00.

The Park & Ride facility is operational 24 hours a day.

The non-covered car park near the ERL station is still in operation. 229 parking bays are available at the non-covered car park.

Pictures of Salak Tinggi ERL station

The following are some pictures of the ERL station and its surrounding area.

The ERL train passengers are equally made up of locals and overseas visitors, with 50% of them travelling on business purpose.

The ERL management has been doing a good job in providing better or upgraded facilities at the station for the convenience of its passengers.

Facilities available at the station includes escalator, elevator, toilet, prayer room and special facilities for the disabled.

As part of the go-green initiatives, this Salak Tinggi ERL station also allocates a specific area for bicycle parking.

Salak Tinggi Town

Salak Tinggi is the capital of Sepang district in the state of Selangor, Malaysia.

It has a suburb called Kota Warisan to the west, which is home to the Salak Tinggi station where the KLIA Transit Express Rail Link (ERL) from KLIA to KL Sentral stops every half-hourly. Salak Tinggi is also known as the Airport City.

Two mosques can be found in the area with the Masjid Sultan Hisamuddin catering to Bandar Baru Salak Tinggi residents and the Masjid KLIA catering to those living near the airport or the circuit.

The township does not offer much but it is a popular stop over for those on their way to Nilai using the trunk road, especially if they’re looking for some food.

Salak Tinggi is inundated annually by motorsports fans when it hosts the Formula-1 Malaysian Grand Prix at the Sepang International Circuit (SIC).

Increasing Popularity

The Airport City Business Centre is becoming increasingly popular due its proximity to the KLIA and klia2 airports.

It is beside the Salak Tinggi ERL Station where there is a twice-hourly KLIA Transit service to KLIA and KL Sentral (Central transportation hub in Kuala Lumpur city).
